services.name: Biological Treatment (Biodegradation)
services.description: This method relies on the use of microorganisms to break down oil pollutants and convert them into harmless substances like carbon dioxide and water.

steps.title: Site and Pollution Assessment
description: Before starting any treatment process, a comprehensive site assessment must be conducted to determine the type and quantity of pollution.
Analyzing soil and water samples, identifying the types of oil pollutants present, assessing environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity, and pH level.

steps.title: Selecting Suitable Microorganisms
description: After assessing the site, suitable microorganisms are selected to break down the pollutants.
Using different types of bacteria and fungi capable of breaking down oil pollutants and converting them into harmless substances.

steps.title: Optimizing Conditions for Microorganism Growth
description: To ensure the success of the biodegradation process, optimal conditions for microorganism growth must be established.
Adjusting pH levels, controlling moisture levels, providing necessary nutrients for microorganism growth such as nitrogen and phosphorus.

steps.title: Applying Microorganisms to the Contaminated Site
description: Microorganisms can be applied using various methods.

steps.title: Monitoring and Control
description: Regular site monitoring is necessary to ensure the process's effectiveness.
Periodic sampling of soil and water, analyzing the reduction in pollutant concentrations, adjusting environmental conditions as needed.

steps.title: Final Evaluation
description: Conducted to ensure pollution levels have reduced to acceptable standards.

steps.title: Post-Treatment Measures
description: Implemented measures such as site rehabilitation and planting local vegetation.

services.name: Thermal Treatment
services.description: Thermal treatment includes techniques such as incineration, which uses high temperatures to break down organic pollutants into harmless gases. Additionally, a Thermal Desorption Unit (TDU) can be used to treat oil sludge and contaminated solids. The TDU works by heating the contaminated materials in an oxygen-free environment, leading to the decomposition of pollutants without complete combustion.

steps.title: Site and Pollution Assessment
description: A comprehensive site assessment must be conducted to determine the type and quantity of pollution.

Analyzing soil and water samples: Collecting and analyzing samples to determine pollutant concentrations, identifying the types of oil pollutants present: Using laboratory techniques to identify pollutants, assessing environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity, and pH level: This evaluation helps determine the best thermal treatment methods.

steps.title: Selecting Suitable Thermal Treatment Technology
description: After assessing the site, the most suitable thermal treatment technology is selected.

Thermal drying: Heating contaminated soil to evaporate oil pollutants, thermal desorption (pyrolysis): Heating soil to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen to break down pollutants, thermal incineration: Burning oil pollutants at high temperatures to destroy them.

steps.title: Site Preparation
description: To ensure the success of thermal treatment, the site must be appropriately prepared.
Removing vegetation and debris: Ensuring easy access to contaminated soil, preparing equipment: Setting up furnaces and necessary heating equipment.

steps.title: Executing Thermal Treatment
description: Thermal treatment is executed according to the selected technology.
Direct heating: Exposing contaminated soil to heat directly on site using heating devices, indirect heating: Transporting contaminated soil to off-site treatment units where it is heated indirectly.

steps.title: Monitoring and Control
description: Regular site monitoring is necessary to ensure the process's effectiveness.

Monitoring temperatures: Ensuring necessary temperatures are reached to destroy pollutants, periodic sampling: Monitoring the reduction in pollutant concentrations, adjusting the process as needed: Regulating temperature and other conditions to ensure process effectiveness.
Gradual cooling: Slowly cooling the soil to avoid undesirable reactions, soil rehabilitation: Adding organic matter and nutrients to improve soil quality after treatment.

steps.title: Final Evaluation
description: Conducted to ensure pollution levels have reduced to acceptable standards.

steps.title: Post-Treatment Measures
description: Implemented measures such as site rehabilitation and periodic monitoring.
Site rehabilitation: Planting local vegetation to enhance environmental stability, periodic site monitoring: Ensuring no recurrence of contamination.

services.name: Physical and Chemical Separation
services.description: These methods involve using techniques such as sedimentation, filtration, and flotation to separate oil pollutants from water or other materials. Among the techniques used in physical and chemical treatment, the Advanced Oxidation Processing (AOP) unit stands out as an effective method for treating oil-contaminated water. AOP uses ozone as a chemical catalyst to break down oil pollutants into harmless compounds. Ozone, as a strong oxidizing agent, helps in breaking down organic molecules and improving water quality.

steps.title: Site and Pollution Assessment
description: Before starting any treatment process, a comprehensive site assessment must be conducted to determine the type and quantity of pollution.

Analyzing soil and water samples: Collecting and analyzing samples to determine pollutant concentrations, identifying the types of oil pollutants present: Using laboratory techniques to identify pollutants, assessing environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity, and pH level: This evaluation helps determine the best physical and chemical treatment methods.

steps.title: Selecting Suitable Physical Separation Technology
description: After assessing the site, the most suitable physical separation technology is selected.

Filtration: Using filters to separate solid particles from liquids, centrifugation: Using centrifuges to separate pollutants with different densities, gravity separation: Using tanks or basins to separate pollutants based on density, where heavy materials settle and light materials float.

steps.title: Executing Physical Separation
description: Physical separation is executed according to the selected technology.

Filtration: Passing contaminated water or soil through filters to separate solid particles, centrifugation: Placing samples in centrifuges to separate pollutants based on density, gravity separation: Using basins or tanks to settle heavy materials at the bottom and lift light materials to the surface.

steps.title: Selecting Suitable Chemical Separation Technology
description: After executing physical separation, the most suitable chemical separation technology is selected.

Filtration: Passing contaminated water or soil through filters to separate solid particles, centrifugation: Placing samples in centrifuges to separate pollutants based on density, gravity separation: Using basins or tanks to settle heavy materials at the bottom and lift light materials to the surface.

steps.title: Executing Chemical Separation
description: Chemical separation is executed according to the selected technology.

Chemical precipitation: Adding suitable chemicals to contaminated soil or water to precipitate pollutants, chemical oxidation: Adding oxidizing agents to oil pollutants to break them down, ion exchange: Passing contaminated water through ion exchange resins to remove ionic pollutants.

steps.title: Monitoring and Control
description: Regular site monitoring is necessary to ensure the process's effectiveness.

Periodic sampling: Monitoring the reduction in pollutant concentrations, sample analysis: Ensuring the effectiveness of the techniques used in separating pollutants, adjusting the process as needed: Regulating physical and chemical processes to ensure optimal results.

steps.title: Final Evaluation
description: After completing the process, a final evaluation is conducted to ensure pollution levels have reduced to acceptable standards and the site is safe.

steps.title: Post-Treatment Measures
description: After successful physical and chemical separation, post-treatment measures can be implemented such as:
Site rehabilitation: Planting local vegetation to enhance environmental stability, periodic site monitoring: Ensuring no recurrence of contamination.

services.name: Final Disposal
services.description: Amaq Al-Dauleya owns a sanitary landfill, the first of its kind in Libya. The opening ceremony was attended by the Deputy Prime Minister, Acting Minister of Health, Minister of Environment, Director General of the General Administration of Environmental Sanitation at the Ministry of Local Government, and representatives from the Ministry of Higher and Technical Education, along with several public figures, municipal mayors, and directors of environmental sanitation offices in various municipalities.

steps.title: Executing Final Disposal Process
description: The final disposal process is executed according to the selected technology:

Sanitary landfill: Burying waste in sanitary landfill sites designed to prevent pollutant leakage into soil or groundwater, incineration (carbonization): Burning waste in special furnaces at high temperatures to reduce volume and destroy pollutants, stabilization and treatment: Adding chemicals to waste to convert it into stable, non-hazardous materials.

steps.title: Monitoring and Control
description: After starting the final disposal process, regular site monitoring is necessary to ensure the process's effectiveness.

services.description: Amaq Al-Dauleya, through specialized companies under long-term agreements, is engaged in continuous monitoring of emissions and full tracking of environmental pollutants at company sites using advanced SMART technologies. The company also has fixed and mobile laboratories to ensure the quality of environmental work and ensure environmental protection.

description: Before starting any monitoring process, a comprehensive assessment of the site and environmental operations to be monitored must be conducted.

steps.title: Selecting Suitable Monitoring Techniques and Tools
description: After assessing the site, the most suitable monitoring techniques and tools are selected, which may include:

steps.title: Site and Equipment Preparation

steps.title: Executing Environmental Monitoring Process

steps.title: Data Analysis and Results Interpretation

news.title: Amaq Al-Dauleya Showcases Advanced Environmental Technologies at Libya Energy and Economy Summit

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company is honored to participate in the Libya Energy and Economy Summit, where the company presented a comprehensive showcase highlighting its latest advanced technologies, committed to balancing advanced technology with environmental preservation. The company excelled in showcasing innovative aspects of its services, particularly in the collection, cleaning, and treatment of oil losses that arise from exploration, drilling, and maintenance operations. Amaq also reaffirmed its strong commitment to sustainability by adopting environmentally friendly technologies that adhere to the highest international and local standards. Amaq Al-Dauleya's participation in this summit serves as an important opportunity to share its experiences and exchange knowledge with the Libyan oil sector while emphasizing its readiness for effective collaboration in enhancing the sector's infrastructure and driving economic growth in Libya.

news.title: Company Establishes Libya's First Secure Disposal Cell (Sanitary Landfill)

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company takes pride in providing effective and integrated environmental solutions. The company is earnestly working towards playing a key role in development and enhancing the quality of life in Libya. To achieve this goal, the first site for secure disposal of hazardous waste in the country was established. The project aims to organize hazardous waste management processes and unify appropriate policies and methods for sustainable and proper disposal. We are committed to adhering to best practices and leveraging the latest technologies to protect the environment and reduce harmful impacts on the community. The secure hazardous waste disposal site forms a core part of our strategy to mitigate and minimize potential environmental and public health risks. We are committed to delivering our services professionally and systematically, making every effort to achieve our goals in environmental and human health protection. We are confident that our efforts will significantly contribute to building a better future for future generations.

news.title: Strengthening Cooperation Between Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services and the General Electricity Company

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company announced a visit by a delegation from the General Electricity Company to all its sites to strengthen cooperation and exchange expertise in the oil services field. This visit is part of a joint effort to develop current projects and explore new opportunities that benefit both companies. Both parties expressed satisfaction with the visit's outcomes and stressed the importance of maintaining communication and cooperation to achieve their shared goals.

news.title: Halliburton Delegation Visits to Strengthen Collaboration with Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company announced the reception of a delegation from Halliburton, who visited all of Amaq's sites. The purpose of this visit was to strengthen ties and exchange expertise between the two companies in the oil services field. Both parties discussed ways to develop existing projects and explore new opportunities that could benefit both companies. Representatives of the two companies expressed satisfaction with the visit's outcomes and emphasized the importance of maintaining dialogue and collaboration to achieve their shared objectives.

news.title: Ministry of Environment Praises the Sustainable Environmental Technologies of Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services

content.details: The Ministry of Environment conducted an inspection visit to the sites of Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company. The visit included reviewing the advanced technologies used by the company in its operations. The Ministry's delegation expressed admiration for the sustainable environmental practices and technologies employed by Amaq. This visit is part of efforts to enhance collaboration between the oil sector and government entities to ensure adherence to environmental standards and achieve sustainable development. Both parties emphasized the importance of continuing such collaboration to achieve shared goals in environmental protection and sustainability.

news.title: Emissions Monitoring in Collaboration with the Ministry of Environment and the Environmental Police

content.details: Green Life Company, in cooperation with the Ministry of Environment and the Environmental Police, implemented a project to monitor emissions resulting from the recent volcanic eruption in Sicily, Italy. The project includes deploying advanced air quality monitoring systems at strategic locations in Tripoli to ensure precise and effective monitoring of potential emissions. Field teams have been equipped with the latest technologies and advanced devices, including portable air monitors and drones, to ensure comprehensive coverage and accurate analysis of environmental data. This effort aims to protect the environment and public health from the potential harmful effects of the volcanic eruption. Green Life Company reaffirms its commitment to environmental preservation and providing advanced environmental solutions in collaboration with government entities to ensure a healthy and clean environment for all.

news.title: Amaq Al-Dauleya Successfully Completes Oil Waste Treatment at Janzour Station According to Environmental Standards

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Oil Services Company successfully completed the oil waste treatment works for the General Electricity Company at Janzour Station. The tasks included implementing all necessary measures to ensure the safe and environmentally sound disposal of accumulated oil waste, in compliance with international and local environmental standards. This step is part of Amaq Al-Dauleya's commitment to providing the best integrated solutions and services to its clients in the oil and energy sector, while also striving to enhance strategic partnerships with various entities to ensure operational sustainability and achieve the desired environmental and economic benefits.

news.title: Strategic Partnership between Amaq Al-Dauleya and Mellitah Oil & Gas for Environmental Sustainability

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya for Oil Waste has provided its distinguished services to Mellitah Oil & Gas. These services include the treatment and management of oil waste using the latest advanced technologies, ensuring environmental preservation and compliance with global standards. This partnership aims to enhance the efforts of both companies in achieving environmental sustainability and improving operational processes in the oil and gas sector. Amaq Al-Dauleya is proud to offer innovative and integrated solutions that meet the needs of its partners and contribute to achieving their environmental and economic goals.

news.title: Amaq Al-Dauleya Company Begins Providing Handling and Industrial Cleaning Services at Mellitah Complex

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Company has commenced handling and industrial cleaning operations at the Mellitah Complex in the city of Sabratha, affiliated with Mellitah Oil & Gas Company. The services provided by the company include comprehensive cleaning operations, as well as handling and transporting hazardous oil waste from Mellitah Company sites toAmaq Al-Dauleya’s specialized treatment facility. This facility features state-of-the-art technologies to ensure environmental safety and sustainable waste management. This collaboration aligns withAmaq Al-Dauleya’s efforts to strengthen its role as a strategic partner in the oil and gas sector, adhering to health, safety, and environmental standards, while focusing on delivering integrated services that contribute to environmental protection and sustainable development.Amaq Al-Dauleya continues to offer innovative solutions in oil waste management and industrial operations, solidifying its position as a leading company in this field.

news.title: Amaq Al-Dauleya Company Begins Industrial Cleaning and Oil Residue Treatment Operations at Khoms Steam Power Plant

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Company has commenced the implementation of industrial cleaning and oil residue treatment operations at the Khoms Steam Power Plant, affiliated with the General Electricity Company, in the city of Khoms. The operations carried out by the company include managing soil contaminated due to oil spills resulting from operational activities. Amaq Al-Dauleya is committed to applying the highest environmental standards to ensure the treatment of oil waste and contaminated soil using sustainable and safe methods. This contributes to minimizing environmental impact and improving the quality of affected sites. This work is part of Amaq Al-Dauleya’s commitment to supporting national companies in addressing environmental challenges and promoting sustainable development by offering innovative and efficient solutions in the field of industrial cleaning and waste management. Amaq Al-Dauleya Company continues to enhance its role as a strategic partner in oil waste management and industrial cleaning, serving as an environmental partner to the General Electricity Company.

news.title: Amaq International Company Commences Industrial Cleaning and Oil Residue Treatment Operations at North Benghazi Power Plant

content.details: Amaq Al-Dauleya Company has initiated industrial cleaning and oil residue treatment operations at the North Benghazi Power Plant, affiliated with the General Electricity Company. The operations include addressing soil contamination caused by oil spills resulting from operational activities. The company employs the latest environmental technologies to ensure safe and sustainable cleaning of affected sites and the treatment of residues and contaminated soil, thereby minimizing environmental impact and enhancing the safety of the surrounding environment. This project reflects Amaq Al-Dauleya’s commitment to supporting national companies in improving the quality of affected sites and efficiently managing oil waste. These efforts contribute to achieving environmental sustainability and advancing national development. Amaq Al-Dauleya continues to provide pioneering and advanced solutions in industrial cleaning and waste management, solidifying its position as a strategic partner to the General Electricity Company.
